section.title: whoami
section.para: The whoamiwhoami(1) command tells you your username.
section.screen: [root@RHEL5 ~]# whoami root [root@RHEL5 ~]# su - paul [paul@RHEL5 ~]$ whoami paul

section.title: who
section.para: The whowho(1) command will give you information about who is logged on the system.

section.title: who am i
section.para: With who am iwho am i the who command will display only the line pointing to your current session.

section.title: w
section.para: The ww(1) command shows you who is logged on and what they are doing.
section.screen: $ w 05:13:36 up 3 min, 4 users, load average: 0.48, 0.72, 0.33 USER TTY FROM LOGIN@ IDLE JCPU PCPU WHAT root tty1 - 05:11 2.00s 0.32s 0.27s find / -name shad inge pts/0 192.168.1.33 05:12 0.00s 0.02s 0.02s -ksh laura pts/1 192.168.1.34 05:12 46.00s 0.03s 0.03s -bash paul pts/2 192.168.1.34 05:13 25.00s 0.07s 0.04s top

section.title: id
section.para: The idid(1) command will give you your user id, primary group id, and a list of the groups that you belong to.
section.screen: root@laika:~# id uid=0(root) gid=0(root) groups=0(root) root@laika:~# su - brel brel@laika:~$ id uid=1001(brel) gid=1001(brel) groups=1001(brel),1008(chanson),11578(wolf)
